inclusion.criterion: Leriche-Fontaine stage II PAD presenting symptoms of intermittent claudication stable for at least 6 months
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: history of hypersensitivity or any form of allergic reaction or contraindications to NSAIDs, aspirin, and NO-donating drugs
inclusion.label: unknown

inclusion.criterion: male and female patients between 40 and 80 years with Leriche-Fontaine stage II PAD presenting symptoms of intermittent claudication stable for at least 6 months
inclusion.label: met

exclusion.criterion: previous revascularization procedures during the last 6 months or indication for vascular surgery
exclusion.label: triggers

exclusion.criterion: acute coronary syndrome or acute cerebrovascular episodes during the previous 6 months
exclusion.label: triggers

notes: A 46-year-old man presents with dizziness and frequent headaches. He has a family history of CAD, but no other cardiovascular risk factors such as smoking, high blood pressure, and diabetes mellitus and is physically active.
